snippet: The question of what to do with horses who roam the rural West has confounded the federal government for decades.
abstract: Debate intensifies over fate of tens of thousands of wild horses who roam across rural West; Bureau of Land Management says numbers continue to grow at unmanageable rate, despite years of moving them to enclosed pastures; horse advocates argue that government's approach is needlessly cruel and that horses should be able to live out their lives freely; both sides agree situation has reached tipping point
lead_paragraph: The question of what to do with horses who roam the rural West has confounded the federal government for decades.

headline.seo: Wild Horses Are Running Out of Room Off the Range
headline.main: Wild Horses Are Running Out of Room, On and Off Range
headline.print_headline: Wild Horses Are Running Out of Room, On and Off Range
